nouns.defn: the ability, right, or permission to approach, enter, speak with, or use; admittance
the state or quality of being approachable
a way or means of approach
an extensive, continuous part of a surface, space, or body
a part of the earth's surface (land or sea) of considerable and usually indefinite extent
a district without respect to boundaries or extent

prepositions.defn: in the space separating (two points, objects, etc.):

adverbs.defn: in the intervening space or time; in an intermediate position or relation

nouns.defn: a handwritten or printed work of fiction or nonfiction, usually on sheets of paper fastened or bound together within covers.
a game played by two teams of usually five players each on a rectangular court having a raised basket or goal at each end, points being scored by tossing the ball through the opponent's basket.
the round, inflated ball approximately 30 inches (76 centimeters) in circumference, used in this game.
the absence of any cause of events that can be predicted, understood, or controlled: often personified or treated as a positive agency
a possibility or probability of anything happening
a preparation of the seeds of cacao, roasted, husked, and ground, often sweetened and flavored, as with vanilla
a beverage made by dissolving such a preparation in milk or water, served hot or cold
candy made from such a preparation
the interval of light between two successive nights; the time between sunrise and sunset

verbs.defn: to diminish or lessen in extent, quantity, strength, power, etc.
to make less; cause to diminish

nouns.defn: any of a series of steps or stages, as in a process or course of action; a point in any scale.
an academic title conferred by universities and colleges as an indication of the completion of a course of study, or as an honorary recognition of achievement.
